title: Research, Citations, and Information Literacy

vocab.definition: The process of finding information about a topic
A place where you find information, like a book, website, or magazine
Information that tells where you found facts or ideas
Using someone else's words or ideas without giving them credit
A list of sources you used for your research
The name of a book, article, or webpage
The company or group that makes the information available
The web address of a page on the internet
To restate information in your own words
To copy the exact words from a source using quotation marks
Writing short facts and ideas you learn while researching
Important words you use to search for information
Firsthand information, like a diary, photo, or interview
Information written about events by someone who was not there
The person who wrote the text or created the content
The date when the information was published

teachingNotes: Teach students how to find and evaluate sources. Introduce basic citation formats. Emphasize the importance of giving credit to sources and avoiding plagiarism. Practice distinguishing between reliable and unreliable sources.
